title: Three ministries reassigned after Asif Mahmud, Mahfuj Alam resign
body: The government has reassigned responsibilities of three ministries following the resignations of Mahfuj Alam and Asif Mahmud Shojib Bhuyain as advisers. The Cabinet Division issued a notification this evening outlining the changes. Adviser Adilur Rahman Khan has been given charge of the Local Government, Rural Development and Cooperatives Ministry, in addition to his existing portfolio. Adviser Asif Nazrul has been appointed to lead the Youth and Sports Ministry, previously managed by Asif Mahmud. Environment Adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan will now oversee the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, earlier handled by Nahid Islam and then Mahfuj Alam. Mahfuj and Asif Mahmud submitted their resignations to Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday at the State Guest House Jamuna.
